tic_tac_toe.title: Tic Tac Toe
tic_tac_toe.objective_text: The first player to align 3 consecutive pieces (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) wins the game.
tic_tac_toe.pieces_text: Each player has a piece with a distinct color and symbol.
tic_tac_toe.rule1: Players take turns making one move, placing their piece on any empty cell.
tic_tac_toe.rule2: The game continues until a player aligns 3 consecutive pieces, or the board is completely full, resulting in a tie.
tic_tac_toe.end_game_text: The game ends when a player aligns 3 pieces, declaring them the winner by their chosen color. In case of a tie, players may restart the game or exit.

connect4_game.title: Connect 4
connect4_game.objective_text: The first player to align 4 consecutive pieces (horizontally, vertically, or diagonally) wins the game.
connect4_game.board_text: The board is a vertical grid with 7 columns and 6 rows. Pieces are dropped into the columns and fall to the lowest available space.
connect4_game.pieces_text: Each player has a set of pieces in a distinct color (usually red and yellow).
connect4_game.rule1: Players take turns making one move by dropping their piece into any column.
connect4_game.rule2: The piece falls into the lowest available position in the column. The game continues until a player aligns 4 consecutive pieces, or the board is full, resulting in a tie.
connect4_game.end_game_text: The game ends when a player aligns 4 pieces, declaring them the winner by their chosen color. In case of a tie, players may restart the game or exit.

project_opening.title: Project: HEIL Games 4 Development for Web
project_opening.overview_text: The goal of this project is to develop an online version of the classic Connect 4 game, allowing players to compete in a digital environment.
project_opening.objective1: Develop an online version of Connect 4 for web browsers.
project_opening.objective2: Allow human players to compete in real time.
project_opening.objective3: Ensure an intuitive and responsive interface for a pleasant gaming experience.
project_opening.scope_text: The project scope includes the development of both front-end and back-end necessary for the game operation.
project_opening.budget_text: The estimated budget for the project is R$ 100,000.
project_opening.schedule_text: The project is expected to last for 8 hours, with the following key phases:
project_opening.approval_text: By signing below, the Sponsor formally approves the start of the project as described in this document.

rf001.title: RF-001: Display the Game Board
rf001.description: The system must display a game board with 7 columns and 6 rows.

rf002.title: RF-002: Number of Players
rf002.description: Each match must have exactly 2 players.

rf003.title: RF-003: Player Differentiation
rf003.description: Each player must have a distinct color for their game pieces.

rf004.title: RF-004: Control of Pieces
rf004.description: Each player plays with 21 pieces and can only control the pieces of their selected color.

rf005.title: RF-005: Positioning of Pieces
rf005.description: Victory is achieved when 4 pieces are aligned, horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.

rf006.title: RF-006: Victory Identification
rf006.description: Once 4 pieces are aligned, the system must identify and announce the winner by the color of their pieces.

rf007.title: RF-007: End of Game
rf007.description: After identifying the winner, the system must end the game and present a confirmation dialog to start a new game.

rf008.title: RF-008: Start and Restart Game
rf008.description: The system must randomly select a player to start or restart the game.

rf009.title: RF-009: 5 Color/Figure Choices
rf009.description: The system must offer a selection of 5 colors or symbols for players to choose from.

rf010.title: RF-010: Language Options
rf010.description: The system must offer up to 3 language options.

rf011.title: RF-011: Player vs Computer Interaction
rf011.description: The system must allow players to play against a computer opponent.
